name: Iptables
description: Administration tool for IPv4/IPv6 packet filtering and NAT

Basic Commands.val: List all rules with verbose and numeric output
Print all rules in iptables-save format
Append one or more rules to the end of the selected chain
Insert one or more rules in the selected chain as the given rule number
Delete one or more rules at the given position from the selected chain
Set the policy for the chain to the given target
Create a new user-defined chain by the given name
Delete the optional user-defined chain specified

Tables.val: Default table containing three built-in chains: "INPUT", "FORWARD", and "OUTPUT"
Table for NAT containing three built-in chains: "PREROUTING", "OUTPUT", and "POSTROUTING"

Targets.val: Reject the packet and notify the sender
Turn on kernel logging of matching packets and continue traversing the current chain

Parameters.val: Specify the target of the rule
Specify the protocol of the rule or of the packet to check
Specify an interface via which a packet was received

Matches.val: Match source IP in the specified range
Match destination IP in the specified range
Match source port or port range
Match destination port or port range
Match if the source port is one of the given ports
Match if the destination port is one of the given ports
Match the state of a packet
Restrict the number of parallel connections to a server per client IP address (or client address block)
